Create Violin Plot with Boxplot and Dotplot Overlay

Source: R/customized_vis.R
violin_plots.Rd

Generate a combined violin, boxplot, and dotplot visualization for gene expression across different cell identities in a Seurat object with optional statistical comparisons.

violin_plots(
  object,
  features,
  idents,
  groups = NULL,
  colors = NULL,
  binwidth = 0.2,
  file_name = NULL,
  width = 8,
  height = NULL,
  ncol = 5,
  add_stats = FALSE,
  test_method = "wilcox",
  comparisons = NULL,
  p_adjust_method = "BH",
  symnum_args = list(cutpoints = c(0, 1e-04, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1), symbols = c("****",
    "***", "**", "*", "ns"))
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object containing expression data

features

Character vector of gene names to plot

idents

Character string specifying the metadata column to use for grouping cells. This will be set as the active identity of the Seurat object.

groups

Character vector specifying which identity groups to include and their order. If NULL, all identities will be used. Default is NULL.

colors

Named vector of colors for each identity group. If NULL, default ggplot2 colors will be used. Default is NULL.

binwidth

Numeric value for dotplot bin width. Default is 0.2.

file_name

Character string for output png name. If NULL, plot will be displayed but not saved. Default is NULL.

width

Numeric value for plot width in inches. Default is 8.

height

Numeric value for plot height in inches. If NULL, calculated dynamically.

ncol

Integer specifying number of columns in facet layout. Default is 5.

add_stats

Logical indicating whether to add statistical test results to the plot. Default is FALSE.

test_method

Character string specifying the statistical test method. Options are "wilcox" (Wilcoxon rank-sum test) or "t.test" (t-test). Default is "wilcox".

comparisons

List of length-2 character vectors specifying pairwise comparisons to test. If NULL and add_stats = TRUE, all pairwise comparisons will be performed. Default is NULL.

p_adjust_method

Character string specifying p-value adjustment method for multiple testing. Options include "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "BY", "fdr", "none". Default is "BH" (Benjamini-Hochberg).

symnum_args

List of arguments to pass to symnum() for significance symbols. Default is list(cutpoints = c(0, 0.0001, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1), symbols = c("", "", "**", "", "ns")).

Value

A ggplot object

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage without statistics
violin_plots(
  object = object,
  features = c("CD3D", "CD8A", "CD4"),
  idents = "cell_type"
)

# With statistics - all pairwise comparisons
violin_plots(
  object = object,
  features = gene_list,
  idents = "cohort_tp",
  groups = c("Chronic Post-DAA", "ACTG Post-DAA", "SR ≥24W-post-resolution"),
  add_stats = TRUE
)

# With specific comparisons
my_comparisons <- list(
  c("Chronic Post-DAA", "ACTG Post-DAA"),
  c("Chronic Post-DAA", "SR ≥24W-post-resolution")
)

violin_plots(
  object = object,
  features = gene_list,
  idents = "cohort_tp",
  groups = c("Chronic Post-DAA", "ACTG Post-DAA", "SR ≥24W-post-resolution"),
  colors = c("Chronic Post-DAA" = "#F8A19FB2",
             "ACTG Post-DAA" = "#2ED9FFB2",
             "SR ≥24W-post-resolution" = "#FEAF16B2"),
  add_stats = TRUE,
  comparisons = my_comparisons,
  test_method = "wilcox",
  file_name = "expression_violin.png"
)
} # }
